alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 12:21AM MST until January 29 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Blowing and drifting snow is possible with wind gusts up to 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero Bear River Valley, 10 below zero northern Wasatch Front. * WHERE...Northern Wasatch Front and Bear Lake and Bear River Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Watch, from this evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
